TEI:
&teiHeader; &facsimile;
20 Wolston
SEint Wolston, bischop of wyrecestre &punctelev; was here of engelonde
Swiþe holi man he was al is lif &punctelev; ase ich me vnderstonde
Þe &yogh;wile he was a &yogh;ong child &punctelev; clene lif he ladde inov&yogh;
&YOGH;wane oþur children ornen to plei&yogh;e &punctelev; toward churche he drou&yogh;
Seint Edward was kyng þo &punctelev; þat nouþe in heouene is
And þe bischop of wyricestre &punctelev; bri&yogh;ttey hei&yogh;te, iwis
Of þis bischop Bri&yogh;tei &punctelev; seint wolston is ordre nam
Ech aftur oþur, ase it fel &punctelev; so þat he preost bicam
Þe bischop vnderfeng him sethþe &punctelev; and Monek him makede iwis
In þe priorie of wiricestre &punctelev; þat noble hous and gret is
Swyþe wel is ordre he heold &punctelev; in þat priorie
And al is wille was forto pay&yogh;e &punctelev; god and seinte Marie
In none bedde he nolde come &punctelev; ake, &yogh;wane oþere &yogh;eoden þarto
bifore on auter he wolde go &punctelev; his oresones forto do
&YOGH;wane þe dede slep him ouereode &punctelev; þat he ne mi&yogh;te no leng gon
his heued he wolde legge adoun &punctelev; opon þe harde ston
Ope one grece bifore þe Auter &punctelev; oþur is bok þarevnder do
And liggen ane stounde in dweole Miengyngue— &punctelev; al is slep scholde beon so
he nolde þreo dawes in þe wyke &punctelev; noþing eten withalle
Ne no word speken bote his beden &punctelev; for nou&yogh;t þat mi&yogh;te bifalle
þe oþur dawes wel luytel he spak &punctelev; and wel luytel he eat also
bote it were a luyte potage— &punctelev; holde he wolde him þerto
So longue he leouede at wirecestre &punctelev; in þat holie lijf wel stille
Þat he was imaked prior of þat hous &punctelev; muche a&yogh;ein is wille
his Couent he wuste swyþe wel &punctelev; and to alle guodnesse hem drou&yogh;
Of god and alle guode men &punctelev; loue he hadde inou&yogh;
Þe prior[ie][MS. prior] of wyricestre &punctelev; seint oswold bigan er
Þat was bifore seint Wolston &punctelev; nei&yogh; ane hondred &yogh;er
And þat he hadde er bigonne &punctelev; þe oþur fulfulde, iwis
So þat þoru&yogh; heore beire dede &punctelev; strong weork and hei&yogh; þare is
Ase þis holie Man seint wolston &punctelev; in a tyme liet arere
A belhous of swiþe strong weork &punctelev; bellen to hanguy þere
And Machouns aboue and binethe &punctelev; þare aboute were
Bi laddren cloumben up and doun &punctelev; and þat weork bitwene al bere
A man þare clemb up bi one laddre &punctelev; an þo he was up on hei&yogh;
Fram eorþe mo þane fourti fet &punctelev; ase al þat folk isei&yogh;
Dounward he ful, ase he misstap— &punctelev; Men weren sore agaste
Seint wolston stod and biheold &punctelev; hou he was adounward faste
he made þe signe of þe croyz &punctelev; ase he feol toward þe grounde
harmles he feol and hol man inov&yogh; &punctelev; his limes weren hole and sounde
And aros up and dude is weork &punctelev; ase him noþing nere
Louerd, muche is þi mi&yogh;te &punctelev; and þat þou cuddest wel þere
Þat [he] so harde fram so hei&yogh;e feol &punctelev; and of eche harme was sker
Þou art a louerd þat wonderes dest &punctelev; ase seith þe sauter
¶ Hit bifeol so þat bri&yogh;tey &punctelev; þe Bischop of wyricestre, was ded
A clerk was bischop after him &punctelev; þat Men cleopeden aldred
Þat seint wolston louede wel &punctelev; and he louede him also
For ech guod man wole louien oþur &punctelev; it were elles vuele ido
Sethþe it bifel þat þe Erchebischop &punctelev; of Euerwicke was ded
Erchebischop huy maden þar &punctelev; þene bischop aldred
And þe bischopriche of wiricestre &punctelev; vacaunt was and lere
Seint wolston was sone ichose &punctelev; and bischop imaked þere
Bischop him made þe holie man &punctelev; seint Edward þe king
And afeng him in his dignete &punctelev; and tok him is staf and ring
his bischopriche he wuste wel &punctelev; and also is priorie
And aforcede him to serui wel &punctelev; god and seint Marie
Four &yogh;er he hadde bischop ibeo &punctelev; and nou&yogh;t fulliche fiue
þo seint Edward þe holie kyng &punctelev; wende out of þis liue
Gret reuþe it was to al engelond &punctelev; so weilawei þe stounde
For straunge men þere comen sethþe &punctelev; and brou&yogh;ten enguelond to grounde
¶ Harold was þo ri&yogh;htest eyr &punctelev; for non oþur þere nas
Þe croune he bar of Enguelonde &punctelev; &yogh;wuche &yogh;wile so it was
For willame Bastard, þat was þo &punctelev; Eorl in Noremaundie
Þou&yogh;te to winne Enguelond &punctelev; þoru&yogh; strencþe and tricherie
[om.]he let him greiþi folk inou&yogh; &punctelev; and gret poer with [him]1 nam
And with gret strencþe into þe se he him dude &punctelev; and to Enguelonde he cam
he liet ordeinie is fierd wel &punctelev; and is banere up arer[d]e
And destruyde and nam al þat he fond &punctelev; and þat folk sore aferde
¶ Harold heorde herof telle &punctelev; þe king of Enguelonde
he liet greiþie faste is ost &punctelev; a&yogh;ein him forto stonde
Þe baronie of Enguelonde &punctelev; redi was wel sone
Þe king to helpe and heomsulue &punctelev; ase ri&yogh;ht was forto done
Þe weorre was þo in Enguelonde &punctelev; deolful and strong inov&yogh;
And eyþur of oþeres Men &punctelev; alto grounde aslou&yogh;
¶ No strencþe ne hadden þis straunge men &punctelev; þat were icome so newe
A&yogh;einest heom of enguelonde &punctelev; þe &yogh;wyle huy wolden beo trewe
Ake alas þe muchele tricherie &punctelev; þat þo was, and &yogh;eot is
þat brou&yogh;te þo Enguelond &punctelev; alto grounde iwis
For þe englische barones bicomen some &punctelev; ontreowe and false also
To bitrai&yogh;e heomseolf and heore kyng &punctelev; þat so muche heom truste to
¶ Þis Noremauns and þis Englische men &punctelev; ane dai of bataile huy nome
Þare ase þe Abbeie of þe bataille is &punctelev; ate daye togadere huy come
To grounde huy smiten and slowen also. &punctelev; ake alas þulke stounde
Þat Enguelond was þoru&yogh; tresoun &punctelev; þare ibrou&yogh;t to grounde
For þulke þat þe king truste to &punctelev; failleden him wel faste
So þat he was bineoþe ibrou&yogh;t &punctelev; and ouercome atþe laste
And to grounde ibrou&yogh;t, and alle his &punctelev; and al Enguelond also
Into vnecouþe mannes honde &punctelev; þat no ri&yogh;ht ne hadden þarto
And neuereft [it] ne cam a&yogh;ein &punctelev; to ri&yogh;hte Eyres none
Vnkuynde Eyres &yogh;eot huy beothþ &punctelev; ore kingues echone
And nei&yogh;h&yogh;wat alle þis hei&yogh;e Men &punctelev; and of þe lo&yogh;we also
For willam liet [him] crouni king &punctelev; þo þe bataile was al ido
And bisette al enguelond &punctelev; with men of oþere londe
Neuereft to is cuynde heritage &punctelev; ne cam it, ich onderstonde
¶ Þis willam bastard, þat was king &punctelev; sethþe him onderstod
Þat he mid vnri&yogh;hte hadde isched &punctelev; mani ane mannes blod
And þare as þe bataille was &punctelev; ane Abbei&yogh;e he liet arere
Þat "þe Abbeie of þe bataille" is icleoped &punctelev; þat wel noble stand &yogh;eot þere
for heore soulene he as liet arere &punctelev; þat he with vnri&yogh;hte þare aslou&yogh;
Ake euere he heold forth þe kynedom &punctelev; of enguelonde with wou&yogh;
¶ Ake sone so he was king imad &punctelev; and al enguelond bisette
Ase he wolde, with straunge men &punctelev; and no man ne mi&yogh;hte him lette
Þis holie Bischop seint wolston &punctelev; wel ofte him withseide
Þat he with onri&yogh;hte hadde ido &punctelev; a swuch luþer dede
And spac a&yogh;ein him baldeliche &punctelev; and ne sparede for no drede
For he was þo þe cuyndeste englische man &punctelev; þat was of enie manhede
And for alle oþure weren deseritede nei&yogh;h. &punctelev; þe king was with heom[r. him] wrothþ
Þat he was so luyte adrad of him &punctelev; and swor anon is othþ
To pulte him out of is bischopriche. &punctelev; he liet [him] somoune also
To westmunstre, to answerien him &punctelev; of þat he him hadde misdo
¶ Nou nas nou&yogh;t seint wulston &punctelev; wel gret clerk in lore
For þo he scholde to scole gon &punctelev; to churche he &yogh;eode wel more
To westmunstre he cam to is day &punctelev; ase he was isomoned er
Þe king was in grete wrathþe &punctelev; wel prest to kepe him þer
And þe bischop of Caunterburi &punctelev; lanfranc was is name
And þe bischop gondolf of Roucestre &punctelev; alle to don him schame
Seint wolston bifore heom cam &punctelev; þat a&yogh;ein him weren so strongue
Ase a þeof bifore Iustise &punctelev; his dom to vnderfongue
¶ Þe king and þe Erchebischop also &punctelev; speken to him wordes grete
Þat he scholde, ase he wuyrþe was &punctelev; is bischopriche lete
Forto holden swuch dignete &punctelev; to luyte he couþe of lore
And huy him hadden to longue iþoled &punctelev; And þo nolden huy nonmore
And grete foles huy weren þat swuch a fol &punctelev; formest brou&yogh;te in swch mi&yogh;hte
And &yogh;if he was folliche onderfongue &punctelev; huy wolden don him out with ri&yogh;hte
¶ Seint wolston stod wel mildeliche &punctelev; and herknede al þat huy sede
Nadde he noman bote god &punctelev; to his answere him rede
"Sires," he seide, "ri&yogh;ht it is &punctelev; þat ich eoure heste do
For, sire king, þou art mi souerein &punctelev; and þe[r. þu] erchebischop also
Þe Croce ich habbe &yogh;are ibore &punctelev; þat &yogh;e iseothþ here, lo
Aknowe ich am and wel ich wot &punctelev; þat inam nou&yogh;t wuyrþe þerto
&YOGH;wane &yogh;e wollez þat ich as bileue &punctelev; ase man þat vnwurþe is
Wel fain ichulle eouwer heste do &punctelev; ase mine souereines, iwis
Vnbou&yogh;hsome to holie churche &punctelev; iwis inelle be nou&yogh;t
To &yogh;elden hire up ase &yogh;e me hotez &punctelev; ich habbe as here ibrou&yogh;t
¶ Ake, for &yogh;e ne token as me nou&yogh;t &punctelev; I nelle eou take non
Ake him þat as me bitok &punctelev; bifore eov euerechon
Þe guode Man þat as me bitok &punctelev; &yogh;eonde he lijthþ wel stille
Ich as wulle him taken up &punctelev; and þanne ich do eoure wille."
¶ To seint Edwardes toumbe he wende &punctelev; þat was of Marbreston
A[r. and?] nam up is croiz wel mildeliche &punctelev; and smot þe point þaron
Þe staf wende into þe marbreston &punctelev; ase it were in nesche sonde
And þo heo was inne deope inou&yogh; &punctelev; þe guode Man hine liet stonde
"Nou," he seide, "ich him habbe bitake &punctelev; him þat as tok me
And bifore eov here &punctelev; i&yogh;ollden op þe dignete
Takez as nouþe &yogh;wam &yogh;e wollez &punctelev; som þat bet beo in lore
And habbez guod dai nouþe euerechone—; &yogh;e ne mouwen esche me nonmore."
¶ Þis holie Man wende forth &punctelev; amon[g] heom alle wel softe
Þat folk stod ase it were inome &punctelev; and biheolden þe croce wel ofte
hou heo stod in þe Marbreston &punctelev; so deope and so faste
Of þe Miracle heom wondrede alle &punctelev; and some weren sore agaste
Some wenden þarto sone &punctelev; þe croce up forto drawe
Þare nas non so strong of heom &punctelev; þat mi&yogh;hte hire enes wawe
huy porueiden er sire Gondolf &punctelev; bischop of roucestre
Þat he scholde aftur seint wolston &punctelev; beon Bischop of wirecestre
¶ Þe Erchebischop aros him up &punctelev; to saisi þe croiz anon
Þe Bischop of Roucestre wel baldeliche &punctelev; þudereward gan gon
Þe croiz he nam and faste he drou&yogh; &punctelev; in þe Marbreston
he ne mi&yogh;hte hire nou&yogh;t enes wawien. &punctelev; þat folk wondrede echon
And þareaboute wel þicke ornen &punctelev; þat wonder forto seo
Þo þe king and þe Erchebischop isei&yogh;en &punctelev; þat non oþur it ne mi&yogh;hte beo
heom ofþou&yogh;te heore dede &punctelev; and after seint wolstan sende
And þat huy wolden in faire manere &punctelev; heore trespas amende
¶ Þe Messagers iredie weren &punctelev; and aftur him sone wenden
&YOGH;eot þis holie Man for al þe gult &punctelev; is heorte to heom bende
And seide, "ich mot nede do &punctelev; mine souereines wille;"
To court he wende a&yogh;ein to heom &punctelev; wel mildeliche and stille
Þo he was to court icome &punctelev; huy arisen a&yogh;ein him þere
Þe king and þe Erchebischop also &punctelev; and oþere þat þare were
With gret honur huy cleopeden him forthþ &punctelev; and for&yogh;iuenesse him bede
And boden amendi a&yogh;ein him &punctelev; al heore grete misdede
And beden him nime a&yogh;ein is croce &punctelev; and don bi heore rede
For he was bet wuyrþe þareto &punctelev; þane ani oþur, huy seide
¶ "Nai certes, sires," quath seint wolston &punctelev; "þat nere me nou&yogh;t to do
Ich wot wel þat &yogh;e seiden soth &punctelev; þat inam nou&yogh;t wuyrþe þareto
Ake nimeth &yogh;wam eower wille be &punctelev; an oþur þat conne more."
Þe kyng and þe Erchebischop also &punctelev; beden him milce and ore
And seiden þat þere nas non oþur &punctelev; þat so wuyrþe were þareto
Longue it was are þis holie man &punctelev; wolde heore wille do[do added later.]
Ake, forto obeien is souereins &punctelev; he wende forth atþe laste
And nam þe croce wel mildeliche &punctelev; þare he stikede hire er so faste
¶ Also li&yogh;htliche ase aniþing &punctelev; þe croce he gan up drawe
Þat so mani men fondeden er &punctelev; and ne mi&yogh;hten hire enes wawe
Þicke orn þat folk abouten him &punctelev; and no wonder it nas
Þe miracle was sone wide ikud &punctelev; þat so apert was
Men anoureden þis holie Man &punctelev; also muche ase huy mi&yogh;hte
his power þat him was er binome &punctelev; he tok a&yogh;ein with ri&yogh;hte
A&yogh;ein to is bischopriche &punctelev; with gret honour he him drou&yogh;
his Couent vnderfeng him faire &punctelev; with grete noblei&yogh;e inou&yogh;
¶ Þis holie Man ladde al is lif &punctelev; swyþe faire and clene
Sijknesses þare weren wel fewe &punctelev; þat man wolde him offe mene
Þat he ne brou&yogh;te to hele anon &punctelev; þoru&yogh; ore louerdes grace
Sike men wel þicke comen &punctelev; to him in eche place
Deue and doumbe and blinde also &punctelev; he helde þoru&yogh; godes grace
&YOGH;wane huy comen to him &punctelev; ou&yogh;were in ani place
So longue he leouede on eorþe here &punctelev; þat he was of grete elde
His bodi bigan to heuegy swiþe &punctelev; grete feblesse he fielde
¶ A slou&yogh; feuere him cam on &punctelev; þat ne nam him nou&yogh;t ful strongue
Ac heo made is bodi to melte awei— &punctelev; þat laste swiþe longue
Seue ni&yogh;ht bifore þat he deide &punctelev; his breþren he liet fette alle
And liet him alle is ri&yogh;htes do &punctelev; and seide &yogh;wat heom scholde bifalle
Out of þis world to heouene he wende &punctelev; þare he schal ay bileue
In þe Monþe of Ieneuer[19 Jan.] &punctelev; aseint Fabianes eue
¶ A þousend &yogh;er and nie hundret &punctelev; and foure þarebifore
It was þat ore swete louerd &punctelev; on vrþe was ibore
In þe teoþe &yogh;ere also &punctelev; of þe kinedom
Of willam þe rede king &punctelev; þat aftur willam bastard cam[These two v. are written in one line.]
he hadde, are he heonne iwende &punctelev; foure and þritti &yogh;er
And four Monþes and four dawes &punctelev; ibeo in worlde[r. wolde? the other MSS. bishop]
Fourscore &yogh;er he was old &punctelev; and seuene also nei&yogh;h
Are he wende out of þis lijf &punctelev; to þe Ioye of heuene an hei&yogh;
¶ Þo þis holie man was ded &punctelev; þe Monekes comen sone
In þe priorie of wirecestre &punctelev; and duden þat was to done
Wuschen þat bodi, ase it was ri&yogh;ht &punctelev; and to churche it bere
Þe Monekes alle with gret honour &punctelev; þat is breþerne were
Þe seruise abouten him huy duden &punctelev; ase it was wel ri&yogh;ht
And to seggen heore sauteres also &punctelev; þarebi huy woken ani&yogh;ht
¶ Þo it was wel withinne ni&yogh;ht &punctelev; ase huy seiden in heore boke
heom luste slepe swiþe wel &punctelev; þat vnneþes huy mi&yogh;hten loke
And some ne mi&yogh;hten nou&yogh;t furbere &punctelev; ake lei&yogh;en and slepen faste
Some ase it were in dweolkningue &punctelev; heore ei&yogh;ene togadere huy caste
Þat holie bodi, þat lai þare ded &punctelev; among heom in þe bere
Aros up wel mildeliche &punctelev; ase þei it aliue were
And awei&yogh;hte heom euerechon &punctelev; and bigan atþon ende
And al along þe rewe &punctelev; þoru&yogh; þe queor he gan iwiende
And euere ase he awei&yogh;hte heom &punctelev; sumdel he[superscr.] gan heom chide
Þat huy nolden with heore slep &punctelev; heore ri&yogh;hte tyme abide
¶ So muche [was] is holi heorte &punctelev; þe ordre forto wite
Þat he nolde, þei he were ded &punctelev; his breþerne fur&yogh;ite
Þis Miracle was sone ikud &punctelev; ase ri&yogh;ht was þat it were
At wirecestre he was ibured &punctelev; and &yogh;uyt he liht þere
Þare Man may for is holie bodi &punctelev; mani fair Miracle iseo
Nou god graunti þat we mote with him &punctelev; in þe Ioye of heouene beo
